title: When Should You Split Your Dev Team? | Engineering Leadership
description: Over time, your software engineering team will grow. When is the right time to split into multiple teams?

title: Best Size for a Dev Team? | Engineering Management
description: I'm a huge fan of small, tightly-knit powerhouse teams that are structured this way. They can move mountains.

title: Should an engineering manager still write code?
description: This is an age-old question bordering on the religious. In my opinion, it's not a matter of "should" or team size.

title: Best Way to Structure Your Dev Team? | Introducing DEPOT
description: I've long been a firm believer that the best products are built by combining Design, Engineering, and Product Management together into one cohesive organization. At my most successful company, we built our entire product delivery organization around this premise, and we called it DEPOT (Design, Engineering, Product: One Team).

title: Engineering Leader: CTO or VP Engineering?
description: At the top of a software engineering organization, you'll find the CTO and the VP Engineering roles. But what's the difference between them? Here's the way I think about it.
